alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 9:30PM EDT until August 01 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including the following county, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to earlier thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... First Fork, Doe Run, Hatchet Creek, Blackwater River, Little Doe Run, Little River, Big Chestnut Creek, Furnace Creek, Little Chestnut Creek, Dinner Creek, Little Creek and Coles Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rocky Mount... Ferrum... Penhook... Sontag... Western Smith Mountain Lake... Union Hall... Callaway... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
